algorithm_technique: Greedy approach using minimum element and modulo properties.
problem_summary_simple: Reduce array length by repeatedly taking modulo of two elements and replacing them.
problem_summary_technical: Minimize array length by repeatedly applying nums[i] % nums[j] operation. The minimum element is key.
key_insights: The operation nums[i] % nums[j] is related to the Euclidean algorithm for GCD.
If all elements are divisible by the minimum element, the array can be reduced to a single element (the minimum).
Otherwise, at least one element will not be divisible by the minimum, leading to a minimum length of 1.
